content.description: From the boulders a few feet above flat ground, ascend via a flake (right, easier) or a 12' crack system (left, harder) to a ledge. Ascend via a steep tips-sized rail (crux) that mellows out into a slab, then climb a few more feet to the anchor bolts.
content.location:
This route is part of the second area, about 200 ft further down the fire road past the main area of the dam spillway crag. Rap/lower in to the start.

The anchor bolts face inside an east-facing corner (climber's right).

content.description: The route starts with a balanc-y and delicate face that protects with thin nuts. About 20' up you encounter a crack that widens from fingers up to thin hands at the top. A fun route.
content.location: The face to climber's left of the corner ("Unknown A") that has a crack appear halfway up.

content.description: Start up the dihedral, using the crack/arete/counterpressure/whatevs to stay pasted to the rock. The faces steepen in the last few feet, but grant some positive holds right when you need them.
content.location:
This route is part of the second area, about 200 ft further down the fire road past the main area of the dam spillway crag. Rap/lower in to the start.

The anchor bolts are just above the edge of the climb.

content.description:
Start on a ledge underneath a bulge of water-polished rock with a light orange varnish and a discontinuous shallow vertical crack system. Pull over the bulge to some jugs and a sweet jam if you can find it. From there, choose one:

meander left over rougher granite following a sort of soffit, then back right

continue follow the crack system directly up (may go at a different grade)

Then make a few more moves to the anchors.
content.location:
This route is part of the second area, about 200 ft further down the fire road past the main area of the dam spillway crag. Rap/lower in to the start.

The anchor bolts are on flat rock just above the edge of the climb.

content.description: Thin crack with plenty of edges, that make it much more of a face climb.  Significantly harder if one tries to climb this as a pure crack.  It is possible to TR this from Gold Mind (directional recommended), finishing with a face traverse to that anchor.
content.protection: thin to 2", gear anchor or bolts from Gold Mind
content.location: The thin crack immediately left of Gold Mind.

content.description: Follow a thin hands crack and up to a roof with a single bolt, throw a heel hook, and ratchet up over the roof to a sinker hand jam.
content.protection: Quick draw plus stopper and cams to 2.5 inches.
content.location: This short but spectacular crack and roof problem is located uphill and left from "Gold Mind" (5.9) on the Spillway Crag.

content.description: Runs over a small roof to a dihedral leading to the top of a block
content.location: Just to the right of (and on the same block of granite as) "Triple Ripple

content.description: This overhanging thin crack dihedral starts from on top of a small pedestal.
content.protection: Regular rack. Finger-sized cams are useful in the dihedral. Need to build a natural anchor on top.
content.location: This route is in an overhanging dihedral a few yards right of the "Ellery Arete"(5.11a) on Spillway Crag. You can walk off the summit to the right.

content.description: Crux is at the bottom of the climb.  It is a hand crack that does get wider as you go higher.
content.protection: Standard Rack or you can toprope.
content.location: Center of the Spillway Crag.  This is the first cliffband you come to on the old mining road from the Ellery Lake Dam.

content.description: Begin on the right side of the arete, moving up over easy rock to the first bolt, from there three bolts and fun moves on either side of the arete bring you to a stance and the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: The prominent arete just to the right (west) of the Gold Mind crack(s).

content.description: Top-rope out of an alcove at the far east end of the Spillway Crag. The crux involves a piano traverse finger crack.
content.location: On the far east end of the Spillway Crag around the corner from Triple Ripple

content.description: Thin crack between gold mind and Ellery arete
content.location: left of the Ellery arete is a flake that accesses the nice crack on the face.
